wrfhydropy.core.domain module¶

class wrfhydropy.core.domain.Domain(domain_top_dir: str, domain_config: str, model_version: str, namelist_patch_file: str = 'namelist_patches.json')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for a WRF-Hydro domain, which constitutes all domain-specific files needed for a setup.

Copy domain files to a new directory :Parameters: * dir – The destination directory for domain files

  • symlink – Symlink domain files instead of copy
domain_config = None¶

str – Specified configuration for which the domain is to be used, e.g. ‘NWM’

domain_top_dir = None¶

pathlib.Path – pathlib.Paths to *.TBL files generated at compile-time.

hydro_files = None¶

list – Files specified in hydro_nlist section of the domain namelist patches

lsm_files = None¶

list – Files specified in noahlsm_offline section of the domain namelist patches

model_version = None¶

str – Specified source-code version for which the domain is to be used.

pathlib.Path – pathlib.Path to the namelist_patches json file.

namelist_patches = None¶

dict – Domain-specific namelist settings.

nudging_files = None¶

list – Files specified in nudging_nlist section of the domain namelist patches

wrfhydropy.core.ioutils.check_input_files(hydro_namelist: dict, hrldas_namelist: dict, sim_dir: str)[source]¶

Given hydro and hrldas namelists and a directory, check that all files listed in the namelist exist in the specified directory. :Parameters: * hydro_namelist – A wrfhydropy hydro_namelist dictionary

  • file_str – A wrfhydropy hrldas_namelist dictionary
  • sim_dir – The path to the directory containing input files.
wrfhydropy.core.ioutils.open_nwmdataset(paths: list, chunks: dict = None, forecast: bool = True) → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset[source]¶

Open a multi-file wrf-hydro output dataset :Parameters: * paths – List ,iterable, or generator of file paths to wrf-hydro netcdf output files

  • chunks – chunks argument passed on to xarray DataFrame.chunk() method
  • forecast – If forecast the reference time dimension is retained, if not then
  • reference_time dimension is set to a dummy value (1970-01-01)
  • and analysis
Returns:An xarray dataset of dask arrays chunked by chunk_size along the feature_id dimension concatenated along the time and reference_time dimensions

wrfhydropy.core.job module¶

class wrfhydropy.core.job.Job(job_id: str, model_start_time: numpy.datetime64 = None, model_end_time: numpy.datetime64 = None, exe_cmd: str = None, entry_cmd: str = None, exit_cmd: str = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Job represents run-time specific information for a given WRF-Hydro run. A Simulation consists of one or more jobs. For example, adding multiple Jobs can be used to split a Simulation into multiple runs to limit the wall-clock duration of each individual run.

add_hrldas_namelist(namelist: dict)[source]¶

Add a hrldas_namelist dictionary to the job object :Parameters: namelist – The namelist dictionary to add

add_hydro_namelist(namelist: dict)[source]¶

Add a hydro_namelist dictionary to the job object :Parameters: namelist – The namelist dictionary to add

clone(N) → list[source]¶

Clone a job object N-times using deepcopy. :Parameters: N – The number of time to clone the Job

Returns:A list of Job objects
exit_status = None¶

int – The exit status of the model job parsed from WRF-Hydro diag files

hrldas_times = None¶

dict – the HRLDAS namelist used for this job.

hydro_times = None¶

dict – the hydro namelist used for this job.

job_dir¶

Path – Path to the run directory

job_id = None¶

str – The job id.

model_end_time = None¶

np.datetime64 – The model time at the end of the execution.

model_start_time = None¶

np.datetime64 – The model time at the start of the execution.

wrfhydropy.core.model module¶

class wrfhydropy.core.model.Model(source_dir: str, model_config: str, compiler: str = 'gfort', pre_compile_cmd: str = None, compile_options: dict = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for a WRF-Hydro model, which consitutes the model source code and compiled binary.

compile(compile_dir: pathlib.Path) → str[source]¶

Compiles WRF-Hydro using specified compiler and compile options. :Parameters: compile_dir – A non-existant directory to use for compilation.

Returns:Success of compilation and compile directory used. Sets additional attributes to WrfHydroModel
compile_dir = None¶

pathlib.Path – pathlib.Path object pointing to the compile directory.

compile_log = None¶

CompletedProcess – The subprocess object generated at compile.

compile_options = None¶

dict – Compile-time options. Defaults are loaded from json file stored with source code.

compiler = None¶

str – The compiler chosen at compile time.

configure_log = None¶

CompletedProcess – The subprocess object generated at configure.

copy_files(dest_dir: str, symlink: bool = True)[source]¶

Copy domain files to new directory :Parameters: * dest_dir – The destination directory for files

  • symlink – Symlink files instead of copy
hrldas_namelists = None¶

dict – Master dictionary of all namelist.hrldas stored with the source code.

hydro_namelists = None¶

dict – Master dictionary of all hydro.namelists stored with the source code.

model_config = None¶

str – String indicating model configuration for compile options, must be one of ‘NWM’, ‘Gridded’, or ‘Reach’.

object_id = None¶

str – A unique id to join object to compile directory.

pre_compile_cmd = None¶

str – Command string to be executed prior to model compilation, e.g. to load modules

source_dir = None¶

pathlib.Path – pathlib.Path object for source code directory.

table_files = None¶

list – pathlib.Paths to *.TBL files generated at compile-time.

version = None¶

str – Source code version from .version file stored with the source code.

wrf_hydro_exe = None¶

pathlib.Path – pathlib.Path to wrf_hydro.exe file generated at compile-time.

wrfhydropy.core.outputdiffs.compare_ncfiles(candidate_files: list, reference_files: list, nccmp_options: list = ['--data', '--metadata', '--force', '--quiet'], exclude_vars: list = ['ACMELT', 'ACSNOW', 'SFCRUNOFF', 'UDRUNOFF', 'ACCPRCP', 'ACCECAN', 'ACCEDIR', 'ACCETRAN', 'qstrmvolrt'])[source]¶

Compare lists of netcdf restart files element-wise. Files must have common names :Parameters: * candidate_files – List of candidate netcdf file paths

  • reference_files – List of reference netcdf file paths
  • nccmp_options – List of long-form command line options passed to nccmp,
  • see http – //nccmp.sourceforge.net/ for options
  • exclude_vars – A list of strings containing variables names to
  • exclude from the comparison
Returns:A named list of either pandas dataframes if possible or subprocess objects
wrfhydropy.core.outputdiffs.diff_namelist(namelist1: str, namelist2: str, **kwargs) → dict[source]¶

Diff two fortran namelist files and return a dictionary of differences.

Parameters:
  • namelist1 – String containing path to the first namelist file.
  • namelist2 – String containing path to the second namelist file.
  • **kwargs – Additional arguments passed onto deepdiff.DeepDiff method
Returns:

The differences between the two namelists

wrfhydropy.core.simulation module¶

class wrfhydropy.core.simulation.Simulation[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for a WRF-Hydro Simulation object. The Simulation object is used to orchestrate a WRF-Hydro simulation by accessing methods of Model, Domain, and Job objects. Optionally, a scheduler can also be added.

add(obj: object)[source]¶

Add an approparite object to a Simulation, such as a Model, Domain, Job, or Scheduler

base_hrldas_namelist = None¶

dict – base hrldas namelist produced from model and domain

base_hydro_namelist = None¶

dict – base hydro namelist produced from model and domain

Domain – A Domain object

jobs = None¶

list – a list containing Job objects

Model – A Model object

output = None¶

run()[source]¶
